pageContext.claim: “We have to come up with a vaccine. We're working with other countries.”
pageContext.analysis: A worldwide fund-raising effort to aid vaccine research raised $8 billion but United States refused to contribute any funding. “It’s the first time that I can think of where you have had a major international pledging conference for a global crisis of this kind of importance, and the U.S. is just absent,” Jeremy Konyndyk, who worked on the Ebola response in the Obama administration, told The Washington Post.
